author: James Freeman
title: Stocks Get Cheaper
text:
On Monday stocks fell to levels not seen since all the way back in late 2017. The Journal reports:
The long-running global stock rally turned into a rout Monday as the Dow Jones Industrial Average posted its largest-ever point decline and major indexes in the U.S., Europe and Asia gave up their gains for the year. Traders described a growing sense of anxiety as the Dow briefly dropped nearly 1,600 points, a break in the tranquility that has characterized financial markets for much of the past two years. The change in sentiment comes just six trading sessions after the Dow, S&P 500 and Nasdaq Composite surged to...
